sn46.11:1.1: “Mendicants, living creatures engage in the four postures:
sn46.11:1.2: sometimes walking, sometimes standing, sometimes sitting, sometimes lying down. They do so depending on the earth and grounded on the earth.
sn46.11:1.3: In the same way, a mendicant develops and cultivates the seven awakening factors depending on and grounded on ethics.
sn46.11:2.1: And how does a mendicant develop the seven awakening factors depending on and grounded on ethics?
sn46.11:2.2: It’s when a mendicant develops the awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion,
sn46.11:2.3: and equanimity, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.
sn46.11:2.4: That’s how a mendicant develops and cultivates the seven awakening factors depending on and grounded on ethics.”
